citations.narrative:
There was no written contingency plan on file at the facility.
Failure to have a written contingency plan can result in lack of readiness for emergencies or disasters.
Facilities must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment,
transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
Correct by: August 21, 2025

The facility was unable to locate the written exercise plan for dogs. The pens provide adequate space for exercise
according to the regulations.
A documented and approved exercise plan helps ensure that a dogs' space requirements and exercise needs have been
considered and will be provided.
The facility must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide dogs with the opportunity for exercise. In
addition, the plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian. The plan must include written standard procedures to
be followed in providing the opportunity for exercise.
Correct by: August 21, 2025

The medical records for dogs were missing some information. The licensee was administering a five way vaccine
containing distemper and parvovirus to adult dogs on an annual basis and a parvovirus vaccine to pregnant females prior
to whelping but there were no records documenting this.
Failure to document vaccines administered may result in failure to adhere to a vaccine schedule that protects the dogs
from infectious diseases.
Dealers must keep copies of medical records that document the names of all vaccines administered and the dates of
administration.
Correct by: From July 24, 2025 forward
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
